title: RigVeda Hymn 09054

Rig Veda, tr. by Ralph T.H. Griffith, [1896], at sacred-texts.com

HYMN LIV. Soma Pavamana.

1. AFTER his ancient splendour, they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from
The Sage who wins a thousand gifts.
2 In aspect he is like the Sun; he runneth forward to the lakes,
Seven currents flowing through the sky.
3 He, shining in his splendour, stands high over all things that exist-
Soma, a God as Sūrya is.
4 Thou, Indu, in thy brilliancy, pourest on us, as Indra's Friend,
Wealth from the kine to feast the Gods.

Next: HYMN LV. Soma Pavamana.

data.title: HYMN LIV. Indu.
data.describe: AFTER his ancient splendour, they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from The Sage who wins a thousand gifts.
data.feecting:
p:AFTER his ancient splendour, they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from The Sage who wins a thousand gifts.
p:In aspect he is like the Sun; he runneth forward to the lakes, Seven currents flowing through the sky.
p:He, shining in his splendour, stands high over all things that exist- Soma, a God as Sūrya is.
p:Thou, Indu, in thy brilliancy, pourest on us, as Indra's Friend, Wealth from the kine to feast the Devas.
